attributes.action: End the Audit Commission Act 1998 s.15 (4) & (5) cover-up of council pay-offs and end the racial discrimination of s14(1).
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Local Authorities Pay-Offs

For 4 weeks every year, residents in England & Wales can inspect and make copies of their local council's accounts including books, deeds, contracts, bills, vouchers and receipts. Complaints can also be made to the District Auditor.

This 'Right' comes from the Audit Commission Act 1998 section 15.

However sub-sections (4) and (5) ban the public seeing details of deals made by unelected and unaccountable (to the public) council officials who regularly use public money to end the employment ("pay-off") of corrupt, bad or incompetent staff.

"Pay-offs" can cost council tax payers several hundreds of thousands of pounds for a single paid-off individual.  

Council tax payers must have a Right to know how their ever increasing council tax money is being spent.  

Give the public full and total access to their local council accounts and end the racial discrimination of s14(1) which bans some council tax payers (including USA, Norwegians, Swiss, Chinese, Brazilian citizens) inspecting their local council's accounts.

Thank you.

Campaign to Reform English Local Government.
